note: Chain complete: From 1.4.5.4 we have (1/e)·Σ k^n/k\! = (1/e)·Σ_{j} S(n,j)·j\!·Σ_{k>=j} C(k,j)/k\!. From 1.4.5.5 we have Σ_{k>=j} C(k,j)/k\! = e/j\!. Substituting: (1/e)·Σ_{j} S(n,j)·j\!·(e/j\!) = (1/e)·Σ_{j} S(n,j)·e = Σ_{j} S(n,j) = B_n (by 1.1.4 validated). This establishes Dobinski's Formula: B_n = (1/e)·Σ_{k=0}^{∞} k^n/k\!
